Reinstalling macports after system upgrade

17 Dec 2014 on osx

I recently switched my work Macbook and just wanted a clean install, which kept me from reinstalling from TimeMachine Backup. So as usual, I had the problem that after configuring the base system I needed to install macports. After some searching I came across the ability to dump a list of installed ports and reinstall them after an OS upgrade or reinstall. To backup your list of installed ports simply execute the following command:
port -qv installed
The easiest way is to save them directly to a file:
port -qv installed < myports.txt
After that you just uninstall all ports and do a cleanup:

To restore your ports, macports provides a script that takes your list of installed ports as a parameter. You can directly grab it from macports svn or from terminal with curl and run it:

The complete guide can be found here.

Kai Sören Becker

My name is Kai Sören Becker and I’m a web-developer and android enthusiast from Wiesbaden.
